gov.ornl.keva.mem

Class MemTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.ornl.keva.mem.MemTable

  • public class MemTable
extends java.lang.Object
    A mem table is the datastructure that holds actual key-value data in memory. All data is stored in sorted, navigable order to simplify data flushing. After the memtable reaches a certain threshold, the table is flushed onto disk as an sstable.
    Author:
    James Horey

    • Field Detail

      • RECOMMENDED_THRESHOLD

        public static final long RECOMMENDED_THRESHOLD
        Memory threshold before flushing to disk. Normally set to 1/3 the amount of free memory. However, the can override this value during memtable creation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MemTable

        public MemTable(long memThreshold)
        The memtable must know its own threshold values.
        Parameters:
        memThreshold - How large the memtable should be before flushing to disk

      • setPruneOptions

        public void setPruneOptions(PruneOptions pruneOptions)

        Parameters:
        pruneOptions - Prune options

        Estimate current memory usage and check whether we are over the memory threshold.
        Returns:
        boolean True if the table is over the threshold. False otherwise.

      • getUncollapsed

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,StreamIterator<TableValue>> getUncollapsed(TableKey key,
                                                                        java.lang.String branch)
        Get all the historical table values along a single branch associated with the supplied key. The branch is identified using the branch name.
        Parameters:
        key - The table key used to identify the value
        branch - The branch to store the value
        Returns:
        An iterator over all the historical values associated with the key along a specific branch.

      • getCollapsed

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,StreamIterator<TableValue>> getCollapsed(TableKey key)
        Get all the latest, independent values associated with this key. We will need to go through the bucket to reconstruct the latest values.
        Parameters:
        key - The table key used to identify the value
        Returns:
        An iterator over the final, independent values associated with the key

      • getCollapsed

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,StreamIterator<TableValue>> getCollapsed(TableKey key,
                                                                      long time)
        Get all the latest, independent values associated with this key. We will need to go through the bucket to reconstruct the latest values.
        Parameters:
        key - The table key used to identify the value
        time - Prune all values with a wall time less than this time
        Returns:
        An iterator over the final, independent values associated with the key

      • getCollapsed

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,StreamIterator<TableValue>> getCollapsed(TableKey key,
                                                                      java.lang.String branch)
        Get all the latest, independent values associated with this key on the specified branch. Since this is a collapsed value, we should only return a single value.
        Parameters:
        key - The table key used to identify the value
        Returns:
        An iterator over the final, independent values associated with the key
